post_text:
Spartanburg High School is proud to be home to 8 of the 10 National Merit Semifinalists across Spartanburg County! SHS was also celebrated as 4th in the state for the number of students earning this prestigious accolade.

We congratulate these scholastic champions! Their accomplishment is a testament to the dedicated and hardworking staff at SHS and at all our schools. #ToInspireAndEquip #ForwardTogether
shared_text:
Spartanburg High School
13 hrs ·

EIGHT of our seniors were recently recognized as National Merit Semifinalists as part of the 66th National Merit Scholarship Program. In order to qualify as a Semifinalist, students take the Preliminary SAT Test (PSAT) and are the highest scorers in each of the 50 states. Our honorees are Will Beeson, Ilan Falcon, Tristen Godfrey, Andrew (Drew) Lawton, Jackson Van Hyning, Jacob Price, Harrison VanVleet, and Alexander (Xander) Woodfin. They were among 197 students encompassing public, private, and homeschools across South Carolina to achieve the ranking nationwide.
Will, Ilan, Tristen, Drew, Jackson, Jacob, Harrison, and Xander are shining examples of excellence in academics and represent the top 1% of our nation’s high school seniors. We celebrate their success and also commend our dedicated educators whose commitment to academic excellence is standard. #AlwaysAViking

post_text: We are so proud of our students! D7 has traditionally been one of the highest-achieving school districts in the state, and the 2019-2020 school year was no exception. We applaud these students and our teachers. All our teachers (K-12) played a key role in these students’ success. They go above and beyond to inspire and equip our students to do their best, and it shows in these accolades! #toinspireandequip #ForwardTogether
shared_text:
Spartanburg High School
September 9 at 4:12 PM ·

For the 2nd year in a row, Spartanburg High School celebrates a record number of AP Scholars! Advance Placement tests were different than usual for the 2019-2020 school year because of the school closure, but our AP students didn’t let that stop them from receiving recognition of their exceptional achievement on their exams. The College Board has announced an off the charts 140 students who took AP tests last May earned AP scholar Awards - the most in the county and a new school record! Congratulations! #AlwaysAViking

post_text:
This original music performance encouraging students to wear their masks reflects the endless commitment and creativity of our D7 staff!

Drayton Mills Elementary School reading coach and past Teacher of the Year Sherrie Jeffries, retired Teacher of the Year Audrey Hailstock, and custodian Hope Gordon teamed up to write the lyrics and record this amazing video.

"Hope was a logical choice because the children love him at school and he and the other custodians are equally important to the work we do each day at DMES. I thought it would be neat to see him in another role. Audrey and I sing together on the praise team at my church," explained Ms. Jeffries. "All of the lyrics are original. We each wrote the part we sang."

We sure do love our students and everyone is working hard to keep them safe. Wear your mask and wash your hands!

Today D7 families, students and staff sported their favorite college colors and apparel to celebrate National College Colors Day. This year we captured the fun from across the District virtually! Take a look!
As D7 continues to grow a culture of college readiness, this initiative is a fun way to advance important conversations with our young people about college and career goals while building on the excitement of a new football season.
Thank you, families and friends, for sending us your photos!
Have a safe and happy Labor Day weekend! #ForwardTogether

We invite all students to join our VIRTUAL College Colors Day celebration! Please leave your photo in the comment section below or share your social media photos with the hashtag #D7CollegeColorsDay.
College Colors Day is celebrated annually to commemorate the traditions and spirit that embody the college experience by wearing your college team’s colors and apparel. As D7 focuses on our mission to inspire and equip and continues to grow a culture of college readiness, we embrace this celebration as a team. #toinspireandequip #ForwardTogether

post_text:
D7 Families,

Due to the prediction of an increase in COVID-19 cases following the Labor Day holiday, Spartanburg County School District 7 will continue the hybrid A/B schedule for the week of September 8-11. As a reminder, all District 7 schools, including our District 7 Virtual School, will be closed for the Labor Day holiday on Monday, September 7.

Our hybrid attendance schedule for the week of Labor Day will be as follows:

- Cohort B attends Tuesday/Thursday and has remote learning days Wednesday and Friday (note that Friday is a remote day, not an eLearning day)

- Cohort A attends Wednesday/Friday and has remote learning days on Tuesday and Thursday

Tomorrow, District 7 will share plans for the hybrid schedule at the elementary, middle, and high school levels for September 14 onward.

Our hybrid attendance schedule for the week of Labor Day will be as follows:

- Cohort A attends Wednesday/Friday and has remote learning days on Tuesday and Thursday

Tomorrow, District 7 will share plans for the hybrid schedule at the elementary, middle, and high school levels for September 14 onward.

post_text:
Picture this: In art class at Jesse Boyd, Claire Louka arrives in the classroom with a cart complete with individual supplies for that day’s instruction.
Teachers in hands-on classes including art have made adjustments to their school-year plans, as well as to their usual schedules, to meet the needs of students who have returned to in-person learning. We are so proud of our teachers and their optimism.
State guidelines address specific requirements for arts education: supplies must be distributed by the teacher and sanitized after each use and class time must be longer to allow for cleaning and storage of materials. For our virtual elementary students, a vast curriculum has been developed with the ability to teach through distance learning and in our middle and high school art is available in the APEX platform.
For decades, School District 7 has been accredited with one of the most notable fine arts programs in the state of South Carolina. Amidst the pandemic, we are confident about continuing to present art in all facets to promote creativity and culture in our schools.

post_text: Free internet is available at our public libraries. District 7 appreciates their partnership in supporting our students!
shared_text:
Spartanburg County Public Libraries
August 28 at 5:43 PM ·

As students are heading back to school, the Library wants to offer support by offering resources available to students and parents. The library provides free, open access Wi-Fi at all library locations. To access, connect your mobile device or laptop to the “Library” network when visiting one of the Spartanburg County Public Libraries locations. You can access the network from the parking lots as well. Learn more here: http://spartanburglibraries.org/Events/Back-To-School

post_text:
It is with a heavy heart and a great sense of personal loss that we share the news that Myles Wilson, a beloved and long-time member of our District 7 family has died unexpectedly. “Myles has been and will always remain a part of the very fabric of this community. He was a product of D7 and his blood runneth Blue and Gold, “said Superintendent Jeff Stevens. “He was always quick with a smile, eager to help, happy to be part of the team, and in command of a situation. I know our community will join me in extending our deepest sympathies to his wife, Margaret Peach, and in supporting her and their family during this difficult time.”

https://www.goupstate.com/story/sports/high-school/2020/08/29/longtime-spartanburg-ad-facilities-director-wilson-dies/5668833002/

post_text:
As we mark the 50th anniversary of full integration in District 7, we welcome four "new" students who will greet visitors to our District 7 Fine Arts Center for generations to come.

District 7 is fortunate to have this transformative sculpture as a centerpiece for learning, thanks to the vision of former superintendent Dr. Russell Booker and a gift from the family of Don Bain, who chaired our Board of Trustees during integration. Public and private partnerships across our community continue to drive us Forward Together!

#OurD7Story
#ToInspireAndEquip
#ForwardTogether

College student by morning, high school student by afternoon...our first Valkyrie Middle College students have their boots on the ground as trailblazers!

The new partnership between District 7 and Converse College to create a pipeline for future educators will give these students opportunity to earn 30 hours of college level credit during their high school years. Meet some of our first participants in this Herald-Journal article.

#ForwardTogether

post_text:
Census takers haven’t knocked on any doors yet, but they will be soon if you haven’t completed your 2020 Census. Because Spartanburg Counts – please take ten minutes to make a difference for the next ten years by completing your Census online at https://my2020census.gov/
Accurate headcounts can mean a difference of $260,000 per person in federal funding, funds used for schools, hospitals, roads, and public works. Completing the census is a way to participate in our democracy and say “I COUNT!”

We hope these will help you get started smoothly this week! if you need additional support, please contact your teacher or visit our tech tips and support page.

Have a great first week!

post_text: Tom and Jerry, peanut butter and jelly, soap and water, pen and paper - like most things, it takes two to make a thing go right. D7 celebrates two historic first days of school today! Classrooms and faces may look different, but you can still feel the love and energy in our schools. We tip our hats to our virtual school families who will return to learn with a renewed strength and resilience. District 7 will find a way to inspire and equip all our students. Let’s write a proud chapter in our history as we move FORWARD TOGETHER. #forwardtogether #toinspireandequip #OurD7Story

post_text: Great reminders from our Spartanburg Police Department friends!
shared_text:
Spartanburg Police Department
August 16 at 4:56 PM ·

As Spartanburg area schools launch operations tomorrow morning, we encourage all of our citizen drivers to remain knowledgeable of the traffic laws, specifically relating to our school zones and bus stops. Despite the modified schedules due to the COVID-19 pandemic, there will be an increase of traffic on most days during the week. Drivers should slow down below the posted speed limits while traveling through school zones. Countless pedestrians will trek to and from area schools during mornings and afternoons. Keep a watchful eye for our children, their parents and the School Crossing Guards; their safety is paramount.

Here’s a helpful reminder of when it is legal to pass a stopped school bus. Always remember that safety is the most important thing!

post_text:
This informative set of articles covers safety procedures and equipment, virtual school, buses, technology, how schools will handle quarantines, and more. Thank you to the Spartanburg Herald-Journal for spending time speaking with teachers, principals and administrators across District 7 for these stories. While much of what is ahead is uncertain, we are ready to move Forward Together to support our students!

As Carver Middle teacher DeShawn Nesbitt says in one article, “Everything is different, but we’re making the best of it. I mean for right now, this is our new normal, so we have to make the best of it!”

We're on a mission to make the 2020-2021 school year amazing, for everyone! To help make that happen, these newest members of the D7 family offered a thumbs up! 👍
This year, we welcome 42 educators into our new teacher induction program. They represent 12 schools at all levels, elementary, middle and high. Whether you are new to our school system, a veteran educator or a new college graduate starting your first teaching job, we are so excited for you to join the D7 family!
👋 👋 WELCOME, NEW TEACHERS! 👋 👋
#ForwardTogether #OurD7Story

post_text: TODAY IS THE DEADLINE to register for free Internet service provided by the state of South Carolina. Click the link below for information and to sign up.
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7
July 24 at 4:22 PM ·

The state of South Carolina is offering free internet hotspots and internet service to eligible homes with school-aged children. If you are a District 7 family who does not already have an Internet connection in your home, you may qualify for this free, need-based service. The state is providing funding for the program from August – December.

District 7 is helping our families to receive this service. The deadline to register is Wednesday, July 29.

To register or receive more information, please visit:

https://www.spartanburg7.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=21&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=20224&PageID=1

D7 Families,
We are answering your questions about our Return to Learn Plan just as quickly as we can! If you would like our help after reviewing the plan and our Frequently Asked Questions section of the Return to Learn Information Center at https://www.spartanburg7.org/Return2Learn (which is expanding daily!), please email return2learn@spart7.org.

post_text: D7 friends, we are deeply grateful to the United Way and the many members of our D7 and Spartanburg community who support our students through the annual Stuff the Bus campaign! If your family would like to share some of your school supplies resources with children who need support, we encourage you to consider this wonderful avenue to do so. On behalf of the United Way, we are pleased to remind you that the deadline for donating is today. Thank you!￼
shared_text:
United Way of the Piedmont
July 15 at 9:17 AM ·

TOMORROW is the last day to purchase school supplies online for Stuff the Bus! This year will be tough on students and parents whether they are in school virtually or in the classroom. Supplies will go to counselors in all Spartanburg County School Districts who will work to get supplies to students who need them most. text:
D7 friends, we are deeply grateful to the United Way and the many members of our D7 and Spartanburg community who support our students through the annual Stuff the Bus campaign! If your family would like to share some of your school supplies resources with children who need support, we encourage you to consider this wonderful avenue to do so. On behalf of the United Way, we are pleased to remind you that the deadline for donating is today. Thank you!￼

United Way of the Piedmont
July 15 at 9:17 AM ·

TOMORROW is the last day to purchase school supplies online for Stuff the Bus! This year will be tough on students and parents whether they are in school virtually or in the classroom. Supplies will go to counselors in all Spartanburg County School Districts who will work to get supplies to students who need them most. So do some online shopping today for a child in need! https://www.roonga.com/uwpstuffthebus2020

post_text:
By the time our students and staff return to school in August, the landscape on Dupre Drive will reveal an exciting new view - the home of the McCracken Eagles. The McCracken Middle School conversion is a major renovation of the former Spartanburg High School campus.
Demolition of the former ‘A, B, and C-Wing’ buildings has begun and will happen in stages, ultimately making way for a beautiful new green space. As you can see construction is moving at a rapid pace - most of the work to up fit the main ‘D-Wing’ building with new floors, ceilings and new collaboration spaces is complete.
No need for a hard hat, we will share more on the project over the summer. Stay tuned!
In case you missed our first inside look at the exciting new facility you can access our video slideshow here -
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-jnCLar-KxI&feature=youtu.be

SPARTANBURG7.ORG
Draft Operations Plan for COVID-19

Spartanburg School District 7
June 25 at 3:44 PM ·

District 7 Family,

Our draft plan, "Return to Learn," outlining learning models for our 2020-2021 school operations during COVID-19, was emailed to all employees and families today along with a survey link. Your input on these plans as well as the additional information requested via the survey are critical to our planning process.

❗️❗️PLEASE CHECK YOUR EMAIL AND RESPOND TO THE SURVEY BY WEDNESDAY, JULY 1. ❗️❗️

Parents, the email was sent to the address you provided when registering your student(s) with District 7 for this year or prior years. If you did not receive the survey link, please email communications@spart7.org with your name and the name and school of your student.

The plan draft is also posted to our website in both English and Spanish here: https://www.spartanburg7.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=21&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=20088&PageID=1

post_text:
Sometimes the right words are hard to find...and today is one of those days.

Dr. Russell Booker, your D7 family wishes you well in the next chapter of your life and career, but it was a little hard to turn the page today. As we look back over the past decade, our hearts are full. Not only because of the good work that has been done, but also because we drew closer together in the process. The road ahead is full of promise for our district, for you and your family, and most importantly for our children. As we gathered today as a District Office team to cheer you onward, there were many emotions - but most of all, there was love.

Thank you for giving your best to District 7. We promise to carry your torch forward together as we write the next chapter of our story.

#ToInspireAndEquip
#OurD7Story

post_text: As cliché as it sounds, our kids are our future. D7 believes that a socially inequitable society can be remedied with great education and access to knowledge across the board. With that in mind and to contribute to this goal, D7 held a virtual four-week-long summer reading camp for 3rd graders from its elementary schools. Today camp wrapped up as students and their families were greeted to backpacks full of books and teachers full of pride. You can read more in tomorrow’s Spartanburg Herald-Journal. #toinspireandequip #OurD7Story

“The reality is that we are having a spike in South Carolina,” state Superintendent Molly Spearman said. “If you want to go back to school, if you want to go to football games, if you want to cheer on your team, you need to be wearing a mask when you’re out in public.”

District 7 is planning for our reopening and we want students to resume to normalcy to the fullest possible extent. Please, help reduce the spread of COVID-19 by wearing a mask every time you are in public.

post_text:
From summer reading to summer meal drive-thru service D7 is keeping our kids nourished this summer with important resources. Although we’ve made the necessary shift to summer services, we are committed to supporting our families in numerous ways. To that end, D7’s Diversity and Inclusion Department is holding a Food Drive this week from 10 -2 in partnership with Stafford Jewelers to assist families with limited access to enough food and at-home products. Donations can be placed in the bed of the black truck with the sign – "Donations Here". All volunteers will be wearing masks and will assist donors.
There is joy in being able to provide food for the hungry. Thank you in advance for helping us provide these moments of joy.

post_text:
Our children can change the world. They are our hope for the future. In our schools, our young people learn why we celebrate the ideals and character of America: bravery, heroism, patriotism, and equality as well as taking personal responsibility for one’s actions. This collective set of values is more essential to our nation than any individual identity.

As our nation works to find unity and build community, we lift up the voices of our children. To honor that vision, Jeff Kuntz, Helen Tipton, March Moody, and John Moody convened District 7 orchestra students from grades 5-12 for a virtual performance of the America the Beautiful. While the piece has a rich and complex history, we share it today as a hymn of national unity and reconciliation. From sea to shining sea.

It is time to enroll both CURRENT and NEW students in District 7 for the 2020-2021 school year!
Letters containing the registration Snapcode for current students were mailed to homes last week. Parents can enroll their children with this SnapCode via our PowerSchool online registration system via this link https://registration.powerschool.com/family/gosnap.aspx?action=23135&culture=en
Current PowerSchool Parent Portal users should not use the mailed Snapcode and should proceed with registration by logging in to the PowerSchool parent portal.
Additional information and instructions for Snapcode users and parent portal users are available at https://www.spartanburg7.org/studentenrollment
Our goal is to complete the enrollment process by June 15.

It is time to enroll both CURRENT and NEW students in District 7 for the 2020-2021 school year!

Students should be enrolled via our PowerSchool online registration system, which is accessible from your smart phone or any other electronic device. Our goal is to complete the enrollment process by June 15.

Letters containing the registration snapcode for current students were mailed home today and will be emailed to the address in your student's PowerSchool enrollment file. Please be sure to update your email address and add any additional addresses during the enrollment period in order to receive communications from your school in the future.

Current PowerSchool Parent Portal users should not use a snapcode and may proceed with registration now by logging in to the parent portal.

Additional information and instructions for snapcode users and parent portal users are available at https://www.spartanburg7.org/Page/398

District 7 Families,
Our summer meal service begins tomorrow (Wednesday, June 3). Anyone under age 18 is eligible to receive both breakfast and lunch via pickup at the following locations each weekday from 9 a.m. until noon:

- Carver Middle School
- Cleveland Academy of Leadership
- Drayton Mills Elementary School
- E.P. Todd School
- Macedonia Baptist Church
- Maranatha Ministries starts June 8th

For questions and additional information, contact District 7 Food Services at 864.596.8484.

Buses will not deliver meals during the summer.

For more information:
https://www.spartanburg7.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=21&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=20045&PageID=1

post_text:
Students like Justin who show leadership potential can enroll in programs like the Viking Early College through Spartanburg High School. The program, administered by D7 and Spartanburg Community College, provides an opportunity for students to earn both a high school diploma and an Associate in Arts degree while in high school. This inspirational story reminds us how important love, support and encouragement is along the educational journey, and we appreciate Samantha Swann and the Spartanburg Herald-Journal for sharing it.
#OurD7Story

https://www.goupstate.com/news/20200529/mom-son-graduate-from-converse-spartanburg-high

post_text:
This year, our bus drivers, not only provided transportation, but meals, WI-FI and most importantly a warm greeting to many young people in our school district. With that same heart, this afternoon our bus drivers honored the Class of 2020 with a special tribute. “To our seniors, we wanted to show them we care,” Transportation Director Linton Carpenter said. “It’s our way of saying goodbye and letting them know how proud of them we all are. So many of these seniors have grown up with us, riding on our buses starting at five years old.”
So, here’s to the Class of 2020 and to the kids on the bus from the past, the present and the future, this one’s for you too!
Your bus drivers are proud of you! #OurD7Story

post_text:
This unprecedented school year is coming to an end, with classes being canceled and lot of students leaving behind important items. But in D7, students in our schools are getting a last chance to pick up their belongings. Student's items have been bagged in "Peace. Love. Sanitize" totes, and this week are being picked up as children and their families say a last goodbye.
Today – we are sharing some of these celebrations from our District schools. A bittersweet end to the school year.
It's certainly nice to be able to see these smiles! (even under the masks)
#OurD7Story

"The greatest glory of a free-born people is to transmit that freedom to their children." ~William Havard

This Memorial Day District 7 salutes those men and women who have served our great Nation, who sacrificed life and liberty so that we may enjoy the same. Today we honor their memory.

post_text:
Students and families who struggle with homelessness need extra support from our district and our community during the pandemic. Their stories are important to tell, and we appreciate the Spartanburg Herald-Journal for helping to raise awareness.

#OurD7Story
shared_text:
GOUPSTATE.COM
Challenges mount for Spartanburg families living in homelessness

Spartanburg Herald-Journal
May 22 at 7:56 AM ·

Nicole Reed’s children are among 400 students in Spartanburg School District 7 that are classified as homeless under a definition in the federal McKinney-Vento Act. That act says a student is homeless if they lack a “fixed, adequate and regular” nighttime residence. The school district is especially focused on homelessness because it can lead to struggles in school. And those struggles are made worse by the COVID-19 pandemic.

post_text:
Jeffrey and T’Shekia Shippy and their four children have an extra special story to share about their dedication and resilience during this unprecedented time. For all of us who are working across D7 to remain connected with students and to support our families during this pandemic, stories like this warm our hearts and reaffirm that our work is truly a calling. #OurD7Story

Chloe is a second grader at Drayton Mills, Jaylen is a fifth grader at Drayton Mills, Jessoria is a seventh grader at Carver Middle, and Timya is a sophomore at SHS.

shared_text:
Spartanburg High School
May 15 at 7:27 PM ·

Members of the Class of 2020 made their victory lap around Spartanburg High School today during a unique spirit parade! The drive-thru was planned in conjunction with yearbook pick up with our graduates driving through the campus where they were greeted by former teachers and staff. The Class of 2020 is keeping their senior spirit alive and continuing to exemplify Viking Pride! #AlwaysAViking

Members of the Class of 2020 made their victory lap around Spartanburg High School today during a unique spirit parade! The drive-thru was planned in conjunction with yearbook pick up with our graduates driving through the campus where they were greeted by former teachers and staff. The Class of 2020 is keeping their senior spirit alive and continuing to exemplify Viking Pride! #AlwaysAViking

post_text:
Our SHS Viking baseball team planned to mark the centennial celebration of the Negro Baseball League by wearing commemorative jerseys during their spring season. Their plans are being deferred until next year, but today Coach Wes Brown made a special visit to present Dr. Booker and superintendent-elect Jeff Stevens with their honorary “#1 Sluggers” jerseys. Our enthusiastic leaders enjoyed trying them on and testing them out with a little office baseball. We can be sure to spot this duo sporting their jerseys as they cheer the Vikings on next season!
#OurD7Story
#ToInspireAndEqiup

post_text:
As we show new appreciation for health care workers during the pandemic, D7 wants to thank our school nurses and celebrate them during National School Nurse Day! During this unprecedented time our school nurses have not skipped a beat checking in on the ones we love and looking after the individual needs of our transportation and food service workers still on the front lines.
Thank you, school nurses, for fostering trusted relationships with your students and colleagues. It is an incredible honor to recognize your contributions to staff and student health and learning. Thank you for taking care of us.

Thank you, school nurses, for fostering trusted relationships with your students and colleagues. It is an incredible honor to recognize your contributions to staff and student health and learning. Thank you for taking care of us.

With confidence and enthusiasm, each one of our principals has been a force central to enhancing the long-standing reputation for excellence and innovation in D7. They are passionately dedicated to their students, schools and our community. On Schools Principal’s Day, we take this opportunity to thank these outstanding educators. Thank you for the great job you do as leaders in District 7!

(pictured lt to rt by rows) Katrina Robinson-Johnson (E.P. Todd), Rene Ford (McCarthy Teszler), Jada Kidd-Robinson (Whitlock Flex Center), Margaret Peach (McCracken Middle), Dennis Regnier (Pine Street). Tammy Jordan (Mary H. Wright), Charlene Doctor (Early Learning Center), Verotta Kennedy (Viking Early College), Thomas Webster (Drayton Mills), Nicole Thompson (Carver Middle), Meredith Rose (Jesse Boyd), Marquice Clark (Cleveland Academy). Shawna Bynum (The Franklin School), Raine Hackler (Meeting Street Academy), Vance Jones (SHS), Kira Reaves (Daniel Morgan Technology Center), Erin Black (Spartanburg County Adult Education).

Please show them some love! #OurD7Story

post_text:
D7 Families, Hub City Farmers Market is offering access to free food during these trying times as well as learning opportunities for students.

1) If you are experiencing financial difficulties, you are eligible to receive a $10 Market Voucher which can be spent at the Saturday Market or at one of the Mobile Market stops. Each adult household member is eligible for a $10 voucher.

2) The Seed-to-Table program is now offering Seed-to-Table Video Lessons which can be found at https://www.hubcityfm.org/seed-to-table-videos. Two lessons are posted a week. Students who watch at least one video are are eligible to receive a $10 voucher.

To receive your vouchers for either of the opportunities above, visit the HCFM booth at Saturday Market. All you need to do is let them know you would like these - no proof of need or participation is required. Alternatively, you can receive and redeem your voucher on the Mobile Market, whose schedule can be found here: https://www.hubcityfm.org/mobile-market.

post_text: The AcceleratedEd Task Force is meeting live right now and District 7 is proud that our own Missy Campbell, CFO, is contributing as a member of this group. The task force was appointed by State Superintendent of Education Molly Spearman. We look forward to the contributions this group will make during this important time in the life of education across South Carolina.
shared_text:
ED.SC.GOV
AccelerateED Task Force - South Carolina Department of Education - 4/30/20 8:30 AM

South Carolina Department of Education
April 30 at 8:30 AM ·

Yesterday, State Superintendent Molly Spearman announced AccelerateED, a task force charged with studying barriers to school operations and student learning during the COVID-19 pandemic and providing recommendations on how schools and districts can best restart in the fall. The task force, comprised of educators and administrators representing all aspects of the K-12 public education system, will also be examining how best to proceed with summer learning activities.

AccelerateED is comprised of twelve core members plus a chair and will also receive input from a larger advisory group as well as the education community and general public.

The task force's first meeting will be held on TODAY at 10:00 a.m. via video conference. The meeting will be live streamed and available to media and the public by visiting the link below.

https://bit.ly/accelerateed

post_text:
How phenomenal is this – a rare chance for students to get some one-on-one time with a revered leader in education. Ron Clark showed up as a surprise guest on a Zoom session this morning with Angela Eaton’s Teacher Cadet class from Spartanburg High School. But it gets better! Mr. Clark offered all educators in D7 an opportunity to take part in a Zoom PD session on distance learning this afternoon. Melody Nease from Jesse Boyd said she loved Ron Clark’s energy, ideas and tips for helping students succeed during distance learning.
Ours learning and growth – both at the student level and at the teacher level - does not stop just because our buildings are closed!
To inspire and equip - two words from our mission statement - continue to capture the spirit of District 7’s commitment to our young people.
#OurD7Story

shared_text:
Spartanburg Academic Movement
April 23 at 12:30 PM ·

C'mon Spartanburg, we're at 50.3% self-response rate. It's better than the 46.5% SC rate, but we MUST do better in support of our children! The images show data from the 2010 census regarding the exclusion rates of young children from the count. Most of those children are now 3rd/4th graders whose needs were not calculated from the data we generated. Let's ensure this does not happen again. Spread the word! The CENSUS matters!! https://my2020census.gov/

post_text:
In D7 our Administrative Professionals have full hands and full hearts! Today, Administrative Professional Day, we salute them across D7 for the role the play to bring hope, inspiration, and love into the lives of our young people.
On behalf of the entire D7 family, we thank them for what they do - up front and behind the scenes - to support our students and the college-going cultures in our schools. We are grateful to have such a dedicated and hard-working team!
#OurD7Story

post_text:
It’s Earth Day 2020! 🌎This year will mark the 50th anniversary of this holiday. We encourage you to enjoy the lovely scent of fresh air, clean up some litter, plant a tree, or simply enjoy companionship with nature! Walk through the woods in search of emerging wildflowers and green moss. Go outside (safely), and enjoy this gorgeous day!
Please share with us in the comment section a picture how you’re celebrating our home planet today! 🍃🌱🌍

post_text:
Hey hey hey, we spot student musicians in the pit! Tune in to hear D7 orchestra students as they accompany the dancers of Ballet Spartanburg in this original piece "Easy Easel." All we can say is WOW!
What an amazing collaboration with our Spartanburg High School Chamber Orchestra. Kudos to D7’s Orchestra Coordinator/Conductor Jeff Kuntz. We are so proud of you and your phenomenal students!
shared_text:
Spartanburg Philharmonic
April 21 at 10:00 AM ·

On today’s Together SpARTanburg episode, we bring you backstage to hear how the ballet "Easy Easel" was made! A collaboration between Ballet Spartanburg Artistic Director Carlos Agudelo, choreographer Nelson Reyes, and Spartanburg School District 7 Orchestra Coordinator Jeff Kuntz, the production was a part of the DanSynergy Series last March 2019.

First, hear how Carlos, Nelson, and Jeff worked together to create this amazing new work, and then watch to the end to enjoy the full production!

#TogetherSpARTanburg #ArtTogetherAt10 #PerformingArtsTogether #SociallyDistantButTogether

with Ballet Spartanburg and Spartanburg Little Theatre

post_text:
It’s official! Spartanburg High is a 2020 Best High School, based on rankings that U.S. News & World Report published this morning.
The U.S. News & World Report Best High Schools rankings designation proves Spartanburg High School is one of the very best in the state and the nation. The magazine’s 2020 list of America’s Best High Schools was compiled based on six factors as criteria: college readiness, college curriculum breadth, math and reading proficiency, math and reading performance, underserved student performance, and graduation rate.
Furthermore, SHS is at the head of the pack in the number of AP courses we offer and AP passage rate.
The U.S. News’ National ranking is the second national ranking SHS has received this school year (Washington Post’s Jay Matthews “America’s Most Challenging High Schools”). These recognitions reaffirm what we already know to be true – Spartanburg High School is an exceptional school!
We have much to be proud of, Spartanburg! We are thrilled to share this honor with you and our entire D7 family!

post_text:
It’s morning on what would normally be a school day, and in D7 over 40 school buses are ready to go. Our bus drivers are running their normal routes and greeting students at their regular stops as usual. But instead of giving them a lift to school, they’re dropping off much-needed meals and smiles to home-bound students affected by school closures.
Our drivers say doing this for the kids is awesome and so much sweeter when greeted with heartfelt gratitude like this.
For all the details on D7’s student meal deliver ad drive-thru service visit during closure visit https://tinyurl.com/vtd7o5h

post_text:
Amidst this chaos, we are inspired by all of ways our students and staff are managing to stay afloat. It is evident D7 is a community of driven, passionate learners with intense intellectual curiosity. It has brought out the best in the Class of 2020! Hats off to our seniors who have proven they are prepared and ready for the real world and are excited about the milestone of graduation on the horizon.
Show our Class of 2020 some LOVE!
#OurD7Story
shared_text:
Spartanburg High School
April 17 at 1:56 PM ·

Hey Seniors, we are so proud of you! It brought smiles to our faces seeing you pick up your cap and gown. We are pleased to share your smiles with our Viking Nation! Please savor these moments as you look forward to your graduation. Your Viking Family loves you!
#AlwaysAViking

D7 Elementary Families:

Grade level assignments for APRIL 20 - MAY 8 were emailed home today and are available on our website.

Printed copies will be available for pickup at your child's school starting tomorrow, Friday, April 17 at noon. They will remain available around the clock in the bins outside of each school, just as before.

Download the assignments for each grade level here: https://www.spartanburg7.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=21&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=19825&PageID=1

District 7 continues to plan proactively to serve our students through remote and eLearning. As soon as we receive an update about the timeframe for school closures, which is currently planned through April 30, we will share that with you.

post_text:
Need help with schoolwork? The South Carolina Public Library is providing an online tutoring service that you can access for FREE through June 30. It covers practically all content areas and goes through grade 12. The resource is linked from the Discus A-Z List and By Grade Level pages at www.scdiscus.org. Users have access to drop-in live tutoring 7 days a week from 8:00 am - 10:00 pm. Spanish-speaking tutors are available from 2:00 pm until 10:00 pm.
This resource also includes an ACT and SAT Test Prep Center and a Skills Center.
Here’s how to access:
· Go to www.scdiscus.org
· Click on A-Z List of DISCUS Resources
· Click All on the left side of the alphabet
· Click on the Tutor.com logo in the New Resources box
· Click on Home (shaped like a house)
· Click “Take the tour” to see how to get started!

post_text:
All of us in D7 are rallying behind you, parents! We see the tremendous effort you are putting into each day as you help your children with remote learning and provide the structure that gives them some normalcy during this hard and disruptive time.

We see how much you are juggling as you balance your own needs with those of your family. As you devote yourselves to this new way of educating, our appreciation for all you do is beyond words. The partnership we share enables our students to continue to learn and grow.

Sending lots of love and thanks from all of us to carry you through. You are doing a GREAT job!

post_text: It’s important that everyone gets counted...now more than ever! Please share this local video and challenge your family and friends to fill out their Census online today at 2020census.gov.
shared_text:
Spartanburg County Public Libraries
March 18 at 4:15 PM ·

The Census only happens once every 10 years and it’s important that everyone including kids be counted. The census impacts how jobs are brought to our community, where schools are built, how roads and internet are placed, and how disaster relief is funded. There’s only One Spartanburg and One Census Count for the next 10 years. Learn more at 2020census.gov.

post_text:
This week has been declared National Assistant Principals Week to honor and recognize the contributions assistant principals play in the success of students across the country.
Whether they're cheering on our students through eLearning, tweeting about school events, visiting Barrier Island with 5th Graders, handling student attendance, talking with parents about the well-being of their child, planning school improvement activities, evaluating teachers or analyzing data, all too often the leadership of our Assistant Principals can fly under the radar.
But, please know that what they do is critical to the success of District 7 and its young people.
We want to thank our APs for the heart work and hard work they do each and every day for our students, staff and community. Their dedication to helping our district succeed is a perfect glimpse into #OurD7Story.
Happy National Assistant Principals Week!

post_text: In many ways, the importance of the Census is made evident during this pandemic. Many of the resources that flow through our community are tied to the number of children and adults of various age groups living in our midst. This is a once-in-a-decade opportunity to secure the funding and resources our community will need going forward. Please take a moment to do your part by filling out your census survey online (my2020census.gov) or by mail. It is quick and easy!
shared_text:
United Way of the Piedmont
April 1 at 8:38 AM ·

Hit PAUSE on coronavirus for a second... Happy National Census Day! That's right! The Census is still happening and it's more important than ever. In times of crisis, census data is used to help determine where resources go. So take 10 minutes for the next 10 years and complete your census today at my2020census.gov #countmein #icount #wecount #census2020 #completecountsc #sccounts #morethanacount

post_text:
This isn't a joke, it's Census Day! (and April Fool's, but filling out the census is nothing to fool around with).
Ensuring every resident in South Carolina is counted during the 2020 census helps to make sure funding is allocated appropriately to SC AND your local public school and programs like community mental health services, highway construction, and Federal Pell Grants for the next 10 years.

It only takes about 10 minutes, so fill out your Census today!
Go to www.my2020census.gov
#CountMeInSC #SCCounts2020

post_text:
For the first time, in 2020 the U. S. Census Bureau will accept responses online. The process will be quick and secure. You can respond to the census in less time than it takes to finish your morning coffee.
It's also a great opportunity to help your young children learn about counting and the census. You can download the Statistics in Schools interactive storybook and other free materials at census.gov/schools and to learn more about what to expect filling out the census online visit, 2020census.gov.

United Way of the Piedmont
March 18 at 5:07 PM ·

PLEASE READ: There is A LOT happening behind the scenes right now in response to COVID-19! Your United Way of the Piedmont team is hard at work connecting individuals and organizations to resources as well as coordinating local response efforts. But we wanted to take a moment to post something important- how those affected by COVID-19 can get help. 211 is a state-wide resource that can connect anyone to resources in their area, however we've been seeing an incorrect phone number floating around on social media! PLEASE SHARE this post so that everyone in our state has this local, correct info!

post_text:
Spartanburg County School Districts Announce Closure in Response to Coronavirus (COVID-19):

In response to the mandate issued by Governor McMaster this afternoon, all Spartanburg County school districts will be closed for students beginning Monday, March 16 through the end of spring break, with a tentative date to resume of April 6, 2020.

Faculty and staff members (except those who are sick, already on approved leaves, or who are considered at high-risk for COVID-19 by their healthcare provider) are to report to work on Monday, March 16 for a teacher workday.

Any student or parents needing to pick up their backpacks, personal items, technology devices and educational materials, and medications may do so between the hours of 7:30am – 3:30pm on Monday, March 16.

COMPLETE INFORMATION about operations, remote/eLearning, and meal service during the closure period is available here: https://www.spartanburg7.org/Page/9655

post_text:
Move over Idol and The Voice – It’s the Best Singer in District 7!
This Friday, March 13 at 6pm in the new District 7 Fine Arts Center at SHS, 15 student finalists will compete in the Best Singer in the District Finalist Competition. The winner will receive a $500 scholarship and go on to the state contest.
General admission is $10, $5 for children ages 6-12 years old, and free for ages 5 and under. All tickets will be sold at the door beginning 5:00 p.m.
The event promises to be full of excitement!

post_text: Two of District 7’s own were honored at the Palmetto Council of the Boy Scouts of America’s annual dinner last night. Spartanburg High School freshman Noah Banks received the 2020 Scout of the Year Award and Dr. Russell Booker received the 2020 Elbert K. Fretwell Educator Award. Both have been impacted positively by - and had positive impact upon - the Boy Scouts. They were all smiles and full of pride to share the stage with one another. D7 is thankful for our partnership with Boy Scouts and our shared goal of developing the best qualities in our youth.

post_text:
On International Women’s Day, we salute all of the women and girls in our District 7 family. So much of what is right and good in this world stems from our grandmothers, mothers, aunts, sisters, nieces and daughters.

This month, as our nation lifts up Women’s History, seven wise and strong women in our community will join together to discuss the economic mobility of women and girls. Join us for this important conversation on Monday, March 16 at 6 pm in the D7 Fine Arts Center. This event is not for women only - its topic matters to us all!
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7
March 5 at 4:04 PM ·

Come experience the power of "7"!

Join us to hear seven trailblazing women from our Spartanburg community discuss economic mobility for women and girls during District 7's first annual Women's History Month symposium. This free, public event is sponsored by the District 7 Diversity and Inclusion Alliance.

Monday, March 16 at 6 pm in the District 7 Fine Arts Center
#OurD7Story #ToInspireAndEquip

Jennifer C Evins Jameica Byers Hill Araceli H-Laroche Glenda Sims Janet Wilson

post_text: As we bring our month-long celebration of Black History Month to a close, District 7 is pleased to announce that it will be the first school district in South Carolina to support the new International African American Museum in Charleston, SC. As a charter member, we look forward to being a part of and supporting what is expected to be one of the country’s most significant museums and memorials. Learn more about this initiative at https://iaamuseum.org
shared_text:
IAAMUSEUM.ORG
Home - International African American Museum
text:
As we bring our month-long celebration of Black History Month to a close, District 7 is pleased to announce that it will be the first school district in South Carolina to support the new International African American Museum in Charleston, SC. As a charter member, we look forward to being a part of and supporting what is expected to be one of the country’s most significant museums and memorials. Learn more about this initiative at https://iaamuseum.org

IAAMUSEUM.ORG
Home - International African American Museum

It's the FINAL to VOTE! D7 family and friends, please vote for our Principals and Meeting Street Academy! Our fearless teams have been working hard to polish their fancy footwork for tonight’s “So You Think You Can Dance, Spartanburg” competition and they NEED YOUR VOTE! You can VOTE for both D7 teams below. Votes are $10 and each team will keep 100% of the votes raised for their musicals.
D7 Principals: https://www.paypal.com/webapps/shoppingcart?flowlogging_id=10bdbd7af7bb3&mfid=1582832352916_10bdbd7af7bb3#/checkout/openButton
Meeting Street Academy: https://www.paypal.com/webapps/shoppingcart?flowlogging_id=32c24fc451cbc&mfid=1582832394774_32c24fc451cbc#/checkout/openButton

There are also a few seats left tonight's event, use code CFDE for a $10 ticket: https://tickets.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?e=d38c3f85230835aeec30e3a7c90cfc35&t=tix&vqitq=272e2843-5973-4dae-b220-17c0ef5dc6bd&vqitp=3129e229-9f97-453a-b995-f09dc4992dc4&vqitts=1573759457&vqitc=vendini&vqite=itl&vqitrt=Safetynet&vqith=d9242ee5d5553f68e742e3d509486c32
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7 is at Ballet Spartanburg.
February 11 at 10:31 AM · Spartanburg, SC ·

So You Think You Can Dance, Spartanburg is back! And yes, D7 can dance! We prove it every year with our outstanding district-wide musical theatre production.
This year, with some big moves and a little fun, two D7 teams have entered the competition to raise funds in support their spring musicals - Meeting Street Academy students will premiere a song to raise funds for The Lion King and dancing D7 principals will use their fancy footwork to Michael Jackson's "Beat it"! for the smash hit Memphis!
Our teams will keep 100% of the votes raised. You can VOTE for both of our District 7 teams here https://www.balletspartanburg.org/SYTYCDSpartanburg-2020

post_text: Our very own Dr. C.C. Woodson, who was the principal at Carver High School for thirty years and is an iconic figure in D7 history, is celebrated in this tribute for Black History Month.
shared_text:
City of Spartanburg, SC
February 24 at 4:24 PM ·

For today’s #BlackHistoryMonth feature, we’re shining the spotlight on Dr. C.C. Woodson!
.
“Dr. C.C. Woodson was born in Spartanburg, S.C. and attended Carrier Street and Dean Street elementary schools, two of the first black schools in Spartanburg. He received his M.A. in Secondary Administration and Supervision at the University of Michigan. In 1932 he was appointed principal of the Cummings Street High School and Elementary School and remained there until the fall of 1938 when he assumed the position of principal of Carver High School. In 1953, Woodson, as part of a committee from the Palmetto Teachers Association successfully lobbied the State Board of Education for the equalization of teacher salaries.”
.
Did you know that you can view this image and so many more on the Spartanburg County Public Library’s digital archives?! Be sure to check it out for some amazing photographs of Spartanburg history.
.
#blackhistorymonth #blackeducators #spartanburgsc #upstatesc #progress #growth

post_text: SHS commemorative brick deadline is approaching! Those interested in honoring someone with a commemorative brick to be installed at the D7 Fine Arts Center at SHS have until March 1 to order for the first installment and in time for the dedication ceremony on April 24. You can mail your form in or drop it by our offices at 610 Dupre Drive.
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7
February 13 at 12:36 PM ·

PAVE the way to love for someone special this Valentine’s Day with a custom engraved brick paver at the new Spartanburg High School! Bricks are a great way to remember a loved one…to pay tribute…to create a memorial for those who have gone before…to inspire those who come after.
Printable gift certificates and order forms are found on our website - https://bit.ly/2uKFTPH
The FIRST brick order will be placed on March 1. Orders received by March 1 will be installed in time for the dedication of the Fine Arts Plaza on April 24.
Each engraved brick paver is $100, which includes the cost of the paver, the engraving, and a donation to a scholarship fund for students. 100% of the cost is tax deductible. Your gift ensures that both your legacy—and our high school’s rich history—are preserved for future generations.

post_text: It's the final week for School Choice enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year! Information and applications are online https://www.spartanburg7.org/schoolchoice.
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7
February 14 at 3:52 PM ·

As a reminder School Choice is open for the 2020-2021 school year. Although students are assigned to schools based on their residential address, they may apply to attend a school with a certain focus, a school with a unique program, or another school within the district beyond their attendance zone.
If you wish to request enrolling your child in a school other than the one he/she attends, you must complete the application by February 29.
Visit our district or school websites for details on the application process and school choice criteria https://www.spartanburg7.org/schoolchoice - look for this school choice banner on our homepages.

Insightful words by The Other Boys of Summer film director Lauren Meyer on the personal sacrifice and the responsibility of breaking the color barrier. Watch for more!

post_text:
Luther Norman's powerful words and a charge to students at Spartanburg High School.
"Duncan Park, that's your park, you have a rich history, so we are going to entrust that to you"
text:
Luther Norman's powerful words and a charge to students at Spartanburg High School.
"Duncan Park, that's your park, you have a rich history, so we are going to entrust that to you"

post_text:
"Unsung heroes who changed America by pursuing their dreams and rising above hatred and inequality."

D7 was honored to bring awareness to the historic Negro Baseball League with two showings of the documentary The Other Boys of Summer as it's Black History program, particularly given that our city had their own Negro Baseball team, the Spartanburg Sluggers that played at historic Duncan Park (now home to the Spartanburg Vikings).
The film is a story that goes far beyond baseball, truly capturing the importance of diversity and inclusion in a powerful way. Students engaged in a panel discussion with the film’s director Lauren Meyer, and local historians Ed Epps and Luther Norman.
In partnership with the Spartanburg community, an exhibit of the Negro Baseball League’s history featuring memorabilia, important artifacts, videos, and other relics from this time period is on display at the school and is open to the public through the end of February. For more details: https://bit.ly/2SfOZgv

Braves President/CEO Derek Schiller kicked off the evening by welcoming everyone and introducing the film. We’ll share more soon but here’s a link to a little love from NBC in ATL.

post_text:
Congratulations to JBE on their certification renewal as an Apple Distinguished School!

“You could give every student a device – you could give every student ten devices – it’s not going to make a single bit of difference. All the research in the world shows the learning environment matters, the technology matters, the curriculum matters, but what matters most? RAISE YOUR HANDS. IT IS YOU. The classroom teacher is the conduit to unlocking all the creativity and all the learning for every individual you interact with…Not every school leverages technology in the same way, so being part of the distinguished schools means, moving forward, you are part of 470 global elite schools who say ‘we will share our story’.”

https://youtu.be/fHgta12inYk

Although students are assigned to schools based on their residential address, they may apply to attend a school with a certain focus, a school with a unique program, or another school within the district beyond their attendance zone.

post_text:
PAVE the way to love for someone special this Valentine’s Day with a custom engraved brick paver at the new Spartanburg High School! Bricks are a great way to remember a loved one…to pay tribute…to create a memorial for those who have gone before…to inspire those who come after.
Printable gift certificates and order forms are found on our website - https://bit.ly/2uKFTPH
The FIRST brick order will be placed on March 1. Orders received by March 1 will be installed in time for the dedication of the Fine Arts Plaza on April 24.
Each engraved brick paver is $100, which includes the cost of the paver, the engraving, and a donation to a scholarship fund for students. 100% of the cost is tax deductible. Your gift ensures that both your legacy—and our high school’s rich history—are preserved for future generations.

post_text:
The credit for a child’s knowledge often goes to the teacher at school. But we often forget the first and last person many children see each and every school day. Our bus drivers safely transport more than 4,500 children to and from D7 schools every day. As a result of their dedication to ensuring that students are transported safely, our drivers have made the yellow bus the safest transportation system in the country.

Our professional school bus drivers "live the bus driver life" as the first and final link in the daily chain of events for nearly every student. They are true partners in education and clearly espouse our mission, to inspire and equip.

Anyone can drive a car – it takes someone really special to drive a bus! We invite you to join us in celebrating our transportation office during Bus Driver Appreciation Week!

REMINDER: Friday, February 14 is an early release day for students and a collaborative day for educators in all District 7 schools except the McCarthy Teszler School, the Whitlock Flexible Learning Center and the Viking Early College.
Elementary students will dismiss at 11:30am, middle at 12:15pm; and the high school at 1:00pm. Buses will arrive at these scheduled times to transport students home. Monday, February 17 is a regular school day to make up a day missed after heavy rains last week left several roads impassable.

So You Think You Can Dance, Spartanburg is back! And yes, D7 can dance! We prove it every year with our outstanding district-wide musical theatre production.
This year, with some big moves and a little fun, two D7 teams have entered the competition to raise funds in support their spring musicals - Meeting Street Academy students will premiere a song to raise funds for The Lion King and dancing D7 principals will use their fancy footwork to Michael Jackson's "Beat it"! for the smash hit Memphis!
Our teams will keep 100% of the votes raised. You can VOTE for both of our District 7 teams here https://www.balletspartanburg.org/SYTYCDSpartanburg-2020
($10 per vote). For tickets to the event on Thursday, Feb 27, call 864.542.ARTS or go online to balletspartanburg.org for information.

Spartanburg County Emergency Management
February 10 at 1:01 PM ·

We are helping coordinate Debris Relief for those impacted by the 2/6 tornado in Spartanburg County. To qualify, you must have debris on your Personal Property (excludes rental properties) but cannot afford to have it removed. If you meet these requirements, please call 864-595-5368. We will give your information to the agencies that are working hard in our community to restore order. Thank You

post_text: This proud Carver High School graduate of D7 has been an incredible force for good in the Spartanburg community. Our hats are off to you as we celebrate Black History Month, Mayor James Talley! #OurD7Story #ToInspireAndEquip
shared_text:
City of Spartanburg, SC
February 10 at 3:39 PM ·

Today we’re shining the spot light on Spartanburg’s first African American Mayor, James Talley!
.
Mayor Talley was elected to City Council in 1982, and served for 6 months as Mayor Pro Tem. He won his mayoral election in May of 1993, and went on to chair and co-chair many groundbreaking committees in Spartanburg. We are so grateful to Mayor Talley for all of the wonderful things he has done (and continues to do!) for Spartanburg!!
.
#blackhistorymonth #mayor #citycouncil #spartanburgsc #upstatesc #progress

post_text:
District 7 Families: Our schools will resume normal schedule for Monday, February 10.

We know that many of you continue to be impacted by the recent tornado and we will do our best to support all of our families through the recovery process. Please let your child’s teacher or school know if your family has extenuating circumstances. If you need to make special arrangements for bus transportation for your child, please call our Transportation Department during business hours at 864-594-4423. If your family needs a temporary shelter, the Red Cross has opened a few locations across our community. Information is available on their website here: https://www.redcross.org/local/south-carolina/about-us/news-and-events/press-releases/red-cross-opens-shelters-in-upstate-after-storms.html

We are most appreciative of the many teams who have worked around the clock to restore our community!

post_text: SEVERE WEATHER UPDATE: UPDATE: ALL AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES ARE CANCELLED FOR DISTRICT 7 SCHOOLS TODAY (Thursday, February 6, 2020).
text: SEVERE WEATHER UPDATE: UPDATE: ALL AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES ARE CANCELLED FOR DISTRICT 7 SCHOOLS TODAY (Thursday, February 6, 2020).

post_text:
WEATHER UPDATE: Our schools are sheltering and children are safe. District 7 will NOT be dismissing early as we believe our children are safest inside our schools. We are keeping contact with every school across our district and have received reports that all are well. Every precaution is being taken to ensure the safety of our entire community. Families are encouraged to remain sheltered and stay off of roads. District 7 cannot release children while emergency warnings are in effect.

As more information becomes available, we will share it here.

Families are encouraged to remain sheltered and stay off of roads. District 7 cannot release children while emergency warnings are in effect.

CI 101 for Educators

January 23 at 4:48 PM ·

Free professional development designed for educators (all levels and subjects). The training begins with an open-house event at Boiling Springs Elementary where CI practice is improving student outcomes. The remainder of the day is spent at Spartanburg Community College where participants dive into the science and process behind the effective practices, leaving with an implementation plan.

post_text:
According to Apple, E.P. Todd is one of the most innovative schools in the world! The school has received the prestigious Apple Distinguished Schools Award 2019-2022 for being a center of leadership and educational excellence that demonstrate Apple’s vision for learning with technology.
Jesse Boyd Elementary has also been named an Apple Distinguished School, marking the school's second recognition. E. P. Todd and Jesse Boyd are two of only a handful of schools in South Carolina, and 470 schools worldwide, to have gained the status.
Since the implementation of Seven Ignites in the fall of 2013 every school in the district emphasizes hands-on learning and real-world experience, supported by complete iPad and MacBook integration in the classroom. Teachers and staff have worked hard to help students connect mind, heart, and hands. Seven Ignites has helped make that a reality. Congratulations!
shared_text:
E. P. Todd School
January 27 at 10:46 AM ·

E. P. Todd is one of the few schools in the NATION with the Apple Distinguished Award! 🍎👩🏻‍💻🧑🏾‍💻👩🏼‍💻👨🏽‍💻 A huge thank you to Mrs. Bush and Mrs. Despard for all their hard work. We are so proud of you and our amazing teachers who worked hard to receive this. #toddtogether

post_text: Across Spartanburg, communities like the Northside, Highland, and Southside are coming together to create a vision and a plan for a bright future. Last week, Drayton Mills Elementary School hosted a gathering to begin an open exchange of information and ideas among our public and private schools, faith community, health sector, service organizations, business and industry, and citizens who all have a stake in lifting up the Drayton and Beaumont community. Thank you to @palspartanburg, Spartanburg Regional Foundation and Pacolet Milliken for sharing updates. This is collective impact at work, and we are excited to see where the conversation leads.
text: Across Spartanburg, communities like the Northside, Highland, and Southside are coming together to create a vision and a plan for a bright future. Last week, Drayton Mills Elementary School hosted a gathering to begin an open exchange of information and ideas among our public and private schools, faith community, health sector, service organizations, business and industry, and citizens who all have a stake in lifting up the Drayton and Beaumont community. Thank you to @palspartanburg, Spartanburg Regional Foundation and Pacolet Milliken for sharing updates. This is collective impact at work, and we are excited to see where the conversation leads.

post_text:
As we look to the upcoming national holiday that honors the life of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., D7 is reminded of the call that urges us on - to inspire and equip our students for meaningful lives of leadership and service. In observance of the holiday schools and offices will be closed on Monday, Jan 20, 2020.
City of Spartanburg is hosting MLK Unity Week, a centerpiece of the City's Be One initiative. The celebration includes a Unity Walk, a Day of Service, a movie night and the annual capstone celebration event on Monday night. We invite you to participate and to show your support of the dream that Dr. King shared and to unite our community. https://www.cityofspartanburg.org/mlk-unity-week

post_text: Did you know that the Spartanburg Academic Movement holds training sessions to help our community to better understand the many kinds of barriers to learning that children face because of their life circumstances? The Cradle to Career simulation, which these D7 staff members participated in today, helps them see how each step along the way impacts success later in life. More importantly, it shows them how strategically placed support helps overcome those barriers and opens the door for all to succeed.

post_text:
The District 7 school board is pleased to present three highly-qualified finalists for position of superintendent of schools. The District has accomplished much over the last decade and the board looks to the next chapter in our history with a shared commitment to build on this success with a dynamic new leader.
A community reception will be held on Tuesday, January 21 at 6:30pm in the Media Center at Spartanburg High School to provide our community members, parents, and staff an opportunity to meet all finalists and hear from them briefly. There will be comment cards and an online link available for people to share feedback with the school board. https://bit.ly/30uygIH

post_text:
TODAY IS THE DAY!

Come, one and all, to see and celebrate the new Spartanburg High School!
shared_text:
Spartanburg School District 7
January 10 at 2:52 PM ·

The Spartanburg Community is invited to celebrate with us during Spartanburg High School's dedication ceremony and community open house THIS Sunday, January 12, 2020 as we usher in this new era and proudly introduce the new home of the Vikings!

The D7 Fine Arts Center will host the dedication ceremony at 2:30 pm and from 3:30-5 pm guests can explore the new school and campus at their leisure during the Community Open House. Those attending the dedication ceremony should enter campus via the student entrance (#1 on map) and use the three parking areas in front of the Fine Arts Center (#5 on map). For the community open house from 3:30 - 5 pm, you are welcome to park anywhere on campus.

Thank you, Spartanburg! We give thanks for this beautiful home that will inspire and equip future generations. #OurD7Story #ToInspireAndEquip

post_text: Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day! We are grateful for the hard work and dedication provided by law enforcement in our community and our schools. To these brave men and women, we say thank you! Thank you for your doing your job not because you “have” to, but because you “want” to – it’s your calling. D7 LOVES its SROs! #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay #LEAD

post_text:
D7 welcomes Kenneth Myers, Sr. to the Board of Trustees. He, along with recently re-elected trustees Meg Clayton, Clay Mahaffey and Rick Gray (pictured l to r), took their oath of honor during last night’s board meeting. We salute all of our trustees - Sanders Lee, Jeff Mason, Andy Hayes, Kenneth Myers, Meg Clayton, Vernon Beatty, Rick Gray, Clay Mahaffey (l to r) and Sharon Porter (not pictured) - as we celebrate School Board Recognition Month. This annual occasion allows states across the nation to honor the men and women who serve on local school boards. This year, the South Carolina School Boards Association’s theme for the month is – School Board Strong.
The board held an official signing of the Ethical Principles, publicly affirming their vow to uphold effective governance principles and to improve public education in District Seven.
Join us in thanking our District 7 Trustees for the unique role they play in championing our children and advocating for quality education.
text:
D7 welcomes Kenneth Myers, Sr. to the Board of Trustees. He, along with recently re-elected trustees Meg Clayton, Clay Mahaffey and Rick Gray (pictured l to r), took their oath of honor during last night’s board meeting. We salute all of our trustees - Sanders Lee, Jeff Mason, Andy Hayes, Kenneth Myers, Meg Clayton, Vernon Beatty, Rick Gray, Clay Mahaffey (l to r) and Sharon Porter (not pictured) - as we celebrate School Board Recognition Month. This annual occasion allows states across the nation to honor the men and women who serve on local school boards. This year, the South Carolina School Boards Association’s theme for the month is – School Board Strong.
The board held an official signing of the Ethical Principles, publicly affirming their vow to uphold effective governance principles and to improve public education in District Seven.
Join us in thanking our District 7 Trustees for the unique role they play in championing our children and advocating for quality education.

District 7 tips our hat to Spartanburg High School junior Annika McEnroe for making her verbal commitment to UC Berkeley! As a top 100 nationally-ranked swimmer who earned two Olympic trial cuts this summer, Annika is making waves both in the world of swimming and for top academic achievements. We are thrilled to see her stay true to the blue and gold as she heads into her college career! #ToInspireAndEquip #OurD7Story

post_text:
During the Holiday Season more than ever, our thoughts turn gratefully to those who have made this year possible. And in this spirit, we say, simply but sincerely...Thank You!
As we pause to reflect on the gift of our new Spartanburg High School, we give thanks for this beautiful home that will inspire and equip future generations.
You are invited to celebrate with us during SHS's dedication ceremony and community open house on Sunday, January 12, 2020 as we usher in this new era and proudly introduce the new home of the Vikings!
Best Wishes for the Holiday Season and a Happy New Year.

As you make your list and check it twice, an engraved paver at SHS for someone special might be nice!

Honor an alum, a current student, a favorite teacher, a parent or spouse, or even a future Viking with this special, limited time opportunity to create a permanent legacy on the new SHS campus for only $100 per paver.

A customizable certificate is available to present to your recipient. Tie it up with a bow to make the perfect holiday gift!

Get all the details and place your order at https://www.spartanburg7.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=21&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=18495&PageID=1

Spartanburg School District 7
December 2, 2019 at 9:55 AM ·

The perfect gift this holiday season is a custom engraved brick paver at the new Spartanburg High School! Bricks will be installed at the Fine Arts Center entrance plaza and may be engraved with up to three lines of text in honor or memory of someone special. They may be purchased for $100 each with a portion of the cost being tax deductible and benefitting student scholarship through D7's funds at the Spartanburg County Foundation. You can order by submitting payment along with this form found on our website. https://www.spartanburg7.org/cms/lib/SC02205954/Centricity/Domain/4/Brick%20Order%20Form%20for%20Fine%20Arts%20Plaza.pdf

post_text:
And the Emmy Goes to . . . John McAllister! D7 Band Director John McAllister took to the red carpet recently to pick up a golden statuette at the Chicago Midwest Regional Emmy Award ceremony.
The Emmy was awarded to the documentary film A Golden Cross to Bear, directed by Kane Farabaugh, which aired last year on PBS. John composed the film score and was among the four project collaborators to receive the award.
Tuxedo-clad and smiling ear-to-ear, John said, "The best part for me is that usually I'm only brought in to write 'fill-in' music for filmmakers finishing up their products. On this project, I actually scored 100% of the music heard in the film. It was also great to work on a project that told the story of veterans who fought in WWI."
(From Left to Right) John Kassell, Director of Photography; Roger Amm, Producer/Narrator; John McAllister, Composer; Kane Farabaugh, Writer/Director
Follow this link for a synopsis of A Golden Cross to Bear and to learn how to stream the film - https://vimeo.com/ondemand/goldencross

post_text:
Attention Vikings: It’s time to “Turn Up the Norse” in the NEW Viking Arena!

SHS is continuing “Turn Up the Norse” during basketball season, providing sensory items at home girls and boys games to make the events more enjoyable for our fans with sensory needs.

When? Home Varsity Basketball games starting Tuesday, December 10th (Items will be available starting 30 minutes before each game.)

What? Bags with sensory items (including headphones, sunglasses, sensory bottles, & a stress ball) will be distributed.

Where? Items will be at a table at the main entrance OR in the concession stand in the NEW Viking Arena.

How? Fans will be asked to provide their names, signatures, & phone numbers to check-out a sensory bag. Bags must be returned by the end of the last game either to the table or concession stand.

Arena information, a basketball schedule, and a social story are on the D7 & SHS websites & Facebook pages! See https://spartanburgvikingsathletics.com/.

Turn Up the Norse…because we are ready! Go Vikings!

post_text:
Whether it is a school day, a weekend or even a holiday break, you can always spot members of the D7 community inspiring and equipping our students. Last Friday, after Thanksgiving, our Spartanburg High School Viking football players and cheerleaders hosted about 145 Drayton Mills Elementary School 4th and 5th graders for a morning of flag football and cheerleading on the new Viking Stadium field. The event was a reward for DMES students who read six new books to meet the SC Department of Ed’s “Read Your Way to the Big Game” challenge. Thank you to our staff and students who gave their time to support these children, and congratulations to our DMES Dalmations for going the extra mile to READ, READ, READ!
#ToInspireAndEquip #OurD7Story

post_text:
Before you crank up the oven, D7's got the perfect recipe that’s sure to warm your heart. This holiday message is brought to you by our exceptional students from E.P. Todd School and Jesse Boyd Elementary.
Thanksgiving is the perfect time to say “Thank You” and to reflect on the blessings we are given daily to teach and inspire children. We are thankful for each child and every family. From the entire D7 family, we wish you all a very Happy Thanksgiving.

post_text:
Give an Engraved Brick Paver This Holiday Season!

As you plan gifts for the holidays, we hope you'll consider giving a brick paver to be installed at the new Spartanburg High School Fine Arts Center plaza in honor or memory of someone special. Pavers are $100 each. A certificate to present as a gift to your recipient is also available, which may be customized with your name and the paver inscription.

Order pavers and learn more about other opportunities to dedicate spaces throughout the new SHS at https://tinyurl.com/vf2ay7k

post_text: Spartanburg High School student Tristan Wilcox works with the SPO as they prepare to perform his composition. We are proud of our homegrown musicians in D7!
shared_text:
Spartanburg Philharmonic
November 21, 2019 at 6:11 PM ·

Our Youngest Homegrown Composer Tristan Willcox stopped by rehearsals last night to work through his debut piece "Battle at Byrun" with the Phiharmonic ensemble. We can't wait to see it live tomorrow night!
#LocallySourcedMusic #ListenWhereYouLive #LoveLiveMusic #YourSPhil

Thanks Spartanburg High School for giving us such a talented composer.

post_text: Spartanburg High School Varsity Boys finished 4th and Varsity Girls finished 13th in the 5A state cross country meet in Camden, SC yesterday. This sensational group of boys and girls worked hard throughout the season and we're so proud! Congratulations to each team and a special kudos to Mac Salley and John Bolinger for earning All-State honors. #VikingPride

post_text:
Yearbook Excellence Award puts Spartanburg High School's Saga on the map again as the best of the best!
The 2019 SAGA, Dipped in Gold, earned an overall rating of Superior at the South Carolina Scholastic Press Association Fall Conference. Second Place individual awards went to senior Abby Ellett for Clubs Spread, senior Sophia Beyer for Student Life Spread, and former senior Faith Lee for Alternative Copy. Third Place awards went to Sophia Beyer for Academics Spread, junior Madison Ward for Feature Copy and the staff for Theme Development. We applaud and congratulate advisors Lisa McCulley and Angela Eaton and the SAGA staff for this impressive state recognition.

We applaud and congratulate advisors Lisa McCulley and Angela Eaton and the SAGA staff for this impressive state recognition.

post_text:
Carver Middle School has once again been named an AVID National Demonstration School! As an AVID National Demonstration School - a status held by less than 3 percent of AVID schools nationwide – Carver serves as a model. Demonstration schools undergo a rigorous validation process and must be revalidated every few years to ensure high levels of implementation, as well as quality and fidelity to AVID strategies.
This unparalleled honor underscores the dedication among Principal Nicole Thompson and Carver teachers to narrow the achievement gap and ensure more students have the skills necessary to succeed in four-year colleges and universities. Congratulations, Wildcats!

post_text: D7's Teacher of the Year, Crystal Weathers of E. P. Todd School, represented our district at the S.C. Teacher Forum Conference earlier this month. She enjoyed learning more about being a Teacher Leader and looks forward to sharing with her D7 colleagues at our upcoming Teacher Forums. Ms. Weathers is pictured at the conference with S.C. Teacher of the Year, Chandra Johnson, and SC State Superintendent of Education, Molly Mitchell Spearman

post_text:
Celebrating the music of Spartanburg , the Spartanburg Philharmonic will showcase the past and the present in their Homegrown concert this Friday night at the Chapman Cultural Center.
Homegrown features music written by composers in the Upstate including former SHS student Dr. Peter Kay, and SHS music teacher Dr. John Moody. It will also feature sixteen-year-old SHS junior Tristan Willcox, the youngest composer ever featured by the professional orchestra. All pieces will be introduced by local personalities, many of whom graduated from Spartanburg High School or it should definitely be an interesting and entertaining evening. The concert is a chance to pay homage to our local musicians and composers and to show our support for music in our schools and communities.
Get to know Tristan, the youngest composer featured https://bit.ly/2NYROAh and read more in SHS’s recent article in the Norse News.
shared_text:
Homegrown: Tristan Willcox — Spartanburg Philharmonic
His love for the piano began when he was 7 years old. By the time he was 11, he had written his first work for solo piano.

post_text: D7 is excited to see the progress on the new T.K. Gregg facility - future home to our Viking swim team!
shared_text:
City of Spartanburg, SC
November 18, 2019 at 5:06 PM ·

Public, private, and nonprofit investment. It takes all three to move the needle in community development and that’s what you’ll find on Spartanburg’s Northside, with affordable and market rate housing, office development, and our new Dr. T.K. Gregg Community Center all in various phases of construction.
